alert.note: Alert for Sherman (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 30 at 6:25PM CDT until June 30 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northwest Kansas, including the following county, Sherman. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 524 PM MDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring along County Road 27 north of the Beaver Creek. Secondary roadways will be impacted. - This includes the following streams and drainages... South Beaver Creek, Little Beaver Creek, Beaver Creek and Middle Fork Sappa Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northeastern Sherman County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
